properties.name: Building 22 - Alamitos Residence Hall
properties.description: One of the four red brick halls that accommodates approximately 212 residents while being staffed by five student Resident Advisors and a professional live-in Hall Coordinator. The majority of floors are coed by alternate male and female wings and each room measures approximately 11' x 15'.

properties.name: Building 17 - Engineering Laboratories
properties.description: If you cross over Olive Lane Walk from the Rose Garden, you will find yourself here in the Engineering Laboratories, which are part of the College of Engineering. Cal Poly Pomona runs the second largest civil engineering\r\nprogram in the country, with 1,000 students enrolled at any given time. It also boasts the largest engineering program in all of California and the College is consistently ranked very high by the U.S. News & World Report, when it comes to rating institutions of higher education.

properties.name: Building 220A: Center for Training, Technology and Incubation
properties.description: The Center for Training, Technology & Incubation (CTTi) is the unique entrepreneurial anchor of Cal Poly Pomona's business/research park, Innovation Village; offering emerging to medium-size companies the opportunity to lease office and wetlab space designed to expand with company growth; and providing unparalleled access to experts and unique collaborating opportunities.

properties.name: Building 57 - Residence Hall, Palmitas
properties.description: Accommodates approximately 185 students and staffed by five student Resident Advisors (RA) and a professional live-in Hall Coordinator. Each room measures approximately 12' x 14' and has five walls.

Regenerative Studies is located within easy walking distance or a quick shuttle ride to the academic buildings, library, computer labs, dining areas, student union, and parking lots. These facilities have a laundry room, study areas, recreation room/TV lounge, mailboxes, and a community kitchenette. Satellite television service is provided in each room with Wireless Internet Access. Both residential buildings are co-ed and non-smoking.
properties.name: Building 209S - Center for Regenerative Studies
Building 43 - Kellogg Gymnasium
properties.description: The Kellogg Gymnasium is where the Cal Poly Basketball and Volleyball teams play their games. It also is where the Athletics Department is located, along with all of the offices of the sports coaches at Cal Poly.

properties.name: Building 32 - Beef Unit
properties.description: Section of farmland used for raising cows

properties.name: Building 66 - Bronco Bookstore
properties.description: The Bronco Bookstore is stocked with all the textbooks you need for classes as well as Cal Poly Pomona gear, school supplies, and computers, including the latest Apple products. If at all possible, the Bookstore tries to provide used textbook options for thrifty purchasing. To further their cost-conscious strategies, students can also rent books by the quarter at a fraction of the price.

Building 13D - Pre-College TRIO Programs
properties.description: The Federal TRIO Programs (TRIO) are Federal outreach and student services programs designed to identify and provide services for individuals from disadvantaged backgrounds. TRIO includes eight programs targeted to serve and assist low-income individuals, first-generation college students, and individuals with disabilities to progress through the academic pipeline from middle school to postbaccalaureate programs.

properties.name: Building 86 - English Language Institute
properties.description: Building 86 is where the Cal Poly English Language Institute and ELS are located.

properties.name: Building 42 - Bronco Recreation Intramural Complex (BRIC)
properties.description: The Bronco Recreation and Intramural Complex (BRIC) is a 165,000 square-foot recreation center with leisure and lap pools, a 53’ climbing wall, five multipurpose fitness studios, two racquetball courts, indoor jogging track, and much more. A full-service Jamba Juice is located at the BRIC with service windows inside and outside the building, as well as one outside on the pool deck. Outdoor seating is available.

properties.name: Building 2 - College of Agriculture
properties.description: The College of Agriculture prepares students for careers in a wide variety of positions throughout the agricultural, food, apparel/textile industries, environment, science, and healthcare fields.

The Mexican American Student Association (MASA) was founded in 1965 as a community outreach and tutorial service organization. The Mexican-American Student Association is an I.R.A funded.  Instructionally Related Activities aka (I.R.A.) fee funding support is allocated to certain programs, clubs, and organizations, one of the organizations being M.A.S.A.

Innovation Village at Cal Poly Pomona is a premier corporate research and technology park in the Southern California region.  It is a unique environment that provides opportunity for collaboration with university researchers, students, and administration in an environment that promotes excellence.

Building 59 - La Cienega Center (University Housing Services)
properties.description: La Cienega Center is the main office of the University Housing services. Students can go here to have questions and concerns about housing answered. properties.name: Building 8 - College of Science

In addition, you can find the McNair Scholars Program and the Instructional Support Center (ISC) all in Building 8.

properties.name: Building 164 - College of Business Administration
properties.description: A complex with a diverse community of students, teacher-scholars, and staff committed to active learning through the application of theory to practice. properties.name: Building 28 - Fruit/Crops Unit

Additional nonbearing acreage for instructional use exists and new plantings are underway. Part of the land is certified organic. Students are encouraged to gain experience and earn income by participation in the enterprise project program or by working for the campus farm.

properties.name: Building 29 - W.K. Kellogg Arabian Horse Center

properties.name: Building 215 - Agriscapes
Building 26 - Union Plaza
properties.description: W.K. Kellogg, founder of the famous Kellogg Company known for its cereal production, built Union Plaza in the late 1920's as a horse stable for his collection of Arabian horses. The land that Cal Poly Pomona currently resides on was then Kellogg's sprawling ranch, which was turned over to the government during World War II and eventually back to Kellogg. His generosity is responsible for that same land becoming Cal Poly Pomona, and today's Union Plaza is home to the following plethora of campus services: the Pride Center, Student Life, Multi-Cultural Council, the Native American Resource Center, and the Dean of Students.

properties.name: Building 89 - Interim Design Center

properties.name: Building 35A - Art Gallery
properties.description: The W. Keith & Janet Kellogg Gallery was built by the John L. and Helen Kellogg Foundation with support from W. Keith and Janet “Jean” Kellogg in 1988.  This gift was in the spirit of W. Keith’s grandfather, cereal magnate W.K. Kellogg, who donated his land to the State of California for use by Cal Poly in 1949.

properties.name: Building 15 - Library
properties.description: What began as a single reading room has grown into an impressive six-story repository for 2.4 million books and 3,000 periodicals. The University Library underwent a $58.5 million renovation in 2008 to supports its mission to be \"the central intellectual and cultural resource of the campus community.\" The Library is equipped with many computers and group study rooms, including a 24-hour lab with plenty of tables. It also features classrooms and a large lecture hall, as well as a Starbucks, Media Collections section, and the University Writing Center.

The Marriott Learning Center provides students with a a combination of hospitality management, business, and general education coursework designed to assure that students understand the economic, legal, and social forces that shape the hospitality industry. Major coursework emphasizes qualitative and quantitative analysis, marketing and human resources.

properties.name: Building 97 - Campus Center
properties.description: The Campus Center is a multipurpose building for dining, relaxing in front of the big screen television, using the free wireless internet, meeting up with friends, and studying. There are both tables inside and outside, and its close proximity to many other campus buildings makes it a convenient stop on your way to and from wherever you're going. Its Marketplace acts as a food court and is Cal Poly Pomona's most frequented dining facility, with six different dining options such as Taco Bell, Carl's Jr and Panda Express.

After-Hours Nurse Advice Line: 855-272-1723.

properties.name: Building 70 - Los Olivos Commons

properties.name: CLA Building
properties.description: The Administration Building, officially called the CLA Building and referred to on campus as the “pointy building,” is a unique structure that stands out with its open triangular top. Not only has it become a familiar symbol of Cal Poly Pomona and now part of the school’s logo, but the eight- story CLA Building has also been featured in films and commercials, since Hollywood is not all that far away from campus. The CLA stands for “Classroom/Laboratory/Administration,” as it is used for a variety of departments and services such as Campus Tour Information, Development, Financial Aid and Scholarships, National Student Exchange, Photo ID, and the Registrars Office."

properties.name: Building 35 - Bronco Student Center (BSC)
properties.description: The Bronco Student Center (BSC) is the social hub for all things student-related. The BSC is where students are able to eat, meet, study, and play! Whether students need to unwind in the Games Room Etc., grab a bite at the food court, complete homework in the study lounges, or simply hang out with friends, the BSC is the perfect place for all student needs. Indoor and outdoor seating is available.
